modules.title: Number Systems, Boolean Algebra and Logic Gates
topics: Data and number systems: binary, octal, and hexadecimal representation and conversions
BCD, Gray code, Excess-3 code and conversions between them
Signed binary number representation using 1’s and 2’s complement methods
Binary arithmetic operations: addition, subtraction, etc.
Boolean algebra and De-Morgan’s theorem
Logic gates: AND, OR, NOT, NAND, NOR, XOR, XNOR – truth tables and circuit representation
Universal logic gates and their implementations
Sum of Products (SOP) and Product of Sums (POS) forms
Minimization of logic expressions using algebraic, Karnaugh map, and Quine-McCluskey methods

modules.title: Arithmetic and Combinational Circuits
topics: Arithmetic circuits: ripple carry adder, carry look-ahead adder (CLA), carry save adder (CSA), and BCD adder
Subtractor circuit design and implementation
Combinational circuits: encoder, decoder, comparator, multiplexer, demultiplexer, and parity generator
Shannon’s expansion theorem and realization of logic functions using multiplexers
Parity generator design and applications

modules.title: Sequential Logic Circuits
topics: Basic memory elements and flip-flops: SR, JK, D, and T flip-flops
Sequential circuit design methodology: state tables and state diagrams
State reduction method and circuit excitation/output tables
Derivation of Boolean functions for sequential circuits
Finite State Machine (FSM) design using sequential circuit methodology
Registers: parallel load registers, shift registers and their types
Counters: asynchronous (ripple) and synchronous (binary, BCD, Johnson) counters

modules.title: Memory Systems and Logic Families
topics: Memory systems: basic concepts and designs of RAM (SRAM and DRAM), ROM, EPROM, and EEPROM
Programmable logic devices: PLA, PAL, PLD, and gate arrays
Logic families: NMOS and CMOS – operation, characteristics, and specifications
Realization of basic logic gates using NMOS and CMOS technologies
Open collector and tri-state gates, wired-AND connections, and bus operations

textBooks: Morris M. Mano, “Digital Logic and Computer Design”, PHI.
Leach & Malvino, “Digital Principles & Applications”, 5th Edition, McGraw Hill.
R. P. Jain, “Modern Digital Electronics”, 2nd Edition, Tata McGraw Hill.
Brian Holdsworth & Clive Woods, “Digital Logic Design”, 4th Edition.
H. Taub & D. Schilling, “Digital Integrated Electronics”, McGraw Hill.
referenceBooks: John F. Wakerly, “Digital Design: Principles and Practices”.
A. Anand Kumar, “Fundamentals of Digital Circuits”, PHI.
courseOutcomes: Learn binary number systems and design logic circuits using combinational gates
Design and analyze finite state machines (FSMs)
Learn the basics of CMOS logic
Understand the design of various digital components used in VLSI applications
